Title: Tor: Several vulnerabilities
Synopsis:
Tor is vulnerable to a possible buffer overflow, a Denial of Service,
    information disclosure and information leak.

Background.Text: Tor is an implementation of second generation Onion Routing, a connection-oriented anonymizing communication service.

Description.Text: Some integer overflows exist when adding elements to the smartlists. Non-printable characters received from the network are not properly sanitised before being logged. There are additional unspecified bugs in the directory server and in the internal circuits.

Impact.Text: The possible buffer overflow may allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the server by sending large inputs. The other vulnerabilities can lead to a Denial of Service, a lack of logged information, or some information disclosure.

Workaround.Text: There is no known workaround at this time.

P.Text: All Tor users should upgrade to the latest version:
